data.title: Multiline object previews in console
data.body:
In #17333 this was fixed for object prop names, but I think it needs to be fixed for object previews as well.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/22162437/9777ce0c-df03-11e6-9c23-8c8e8fee11f9.png)

data.title: file is very large ....
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-gnu-global|austin|0.2.1|
|CppSnippets|hars|0.0.5|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try to load 100MB text file 
2. Got this error: The file will not be displayed in the editor because it is either binary, very large or uses an unsupported text encoding.

Guys, even Notepad was able to load the file.

data.title: Markdown preview doesn't honor editor font-size (or have a way to bump up its font size)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `1.9.0-insider` ee9d91c05fa571de56c41383cceee30b05b0a2f6
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.2`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change the font-size in settings
2. Open markdown preview -- it is unaffected

data.body: Testing #18091 on OS X El Capitan

data.title: Unable to open 'settings.json': t.toLowerCase is not a function.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `1.9.0-insider` ee9d91c05fa571de56c41383cceee30b05b0a2f6
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.2`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open settings
2. Type into the search box and press enter (nothing happens -- this is another bug -- searching doesn't work)
3. Switch to another tab, and then try to switch back to settings (or close the settings tab and reopen and you will see the following
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/641685/22162194/a37ee402-df1b-11e6-9349-5519b9dea7a5.png)
4. From now on until you close this window, you will get that same error when trying to open the settings -- and the settings won't open

data.title: Cursor and typed words does not match positions in the editor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The latest updates of VS Code insider (version information below) is behaving very badly with the cursor position and what is being typed in.  There were no new extensions downloaded before this happened.  A restart after the vscode update showed this bug right away.

![croppercapture 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/135095/22162067/dfb0d58a-df01-11e6-8288-1f0f50251d74.Gif)


- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (ee9d91c05fa571de56c41383cceee30b05b0a2f6, 2017-01-20T15:08:19.064Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.10.2|
|vscode-instant-markdown|dbankier|0.2.1|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.6|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|live-html-previewer|hdg|0.0.1|
|vscode-todo|MattiasPernhult|0.8.0|
|vscode-apache|mrmlnc|1.1.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.3|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.4.2|
|guides|spywhere|0.6.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download vscode insider per version above.
2. Start typing or selecting or deleting.
2.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Consider going to Stack Overflow vscode sorted by votes
data.body:
Testing #18091

It would probably be more useful to show the most popular questions over the newest (which may or may not have answers):

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode?sort=votes&pageSize=50

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Focus issues while navigating using keyboard
data.body:
Testing #18091 on OS X El Capitan


The "Start", "Recent", "Help" get focus, but the quick links don't.
Quick links do have a hover treatment.
The same can be used for keyboard focus as well.

The check box, gets focus while navigating using keyboard, but there is not much of a visual cue.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Search not working in settings window
data.body:
Type in setting search box and nothing happens. On Windows 10.
Might just be something wrong with that build. Current insiders build is fine.

data.title: Failed to load Extensions gallery behind proxy with ERR_INSECURE_RESPONSE

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:55:32.357Z)
- OS Version: Linux ia32 3.19.0-32-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|


---

Hi, I'm on a corporate network that requires a proxy that injects it's own SSL cert. I have the following user settings:

```js
{
    "http.proxy": "http://proxy:port",
    "http.proxyStrictSSL": false,
}
```

Based on #69 etc, it seems setting `proxyStrictSSL` to false should work for self-signed certificates, but I am unable to even browse the extensions gallery. Console shows the following error:

```
https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/_apis/public/gallery/extensionquery
Failed to load resource: net::ERR_INSECURE_RESPONSE
```

I haven't seen _that_ error code in the issues here yet!

Let me know what other information I could provide to debug this. Thanks!

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Disable extensions or not in Playground
data.body:
Testing #18091

It's more or less a question, should we disable extensions in playaround if we just want users to have an idea about what's the default behavior of Code.

data.title: Markdown preview doesn't resize properly on zoom (Ctrl++)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `1.9.0-insider` ee9d91c05fa571de56c41383cceee30b05b0a2f6
- OS Version: macOS Sierra `10.12.2`

This also happens on vscode `1.8`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open markdown preview
2. Press Ctrl++ to zoom in

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/641685/22161772/c7e9dfe2-df19-11e6-8050-21fea11d59ec.png)

Its a bit hard to see but the the preview content isn't filling the whole area -- there is a big empty space on both the right and bottom.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Console error while opening any of the recent folders
data.body: Testing #18091 on OS X El Capitan

data.title: [WelcomeUX] text should be selectable in editor walkthrough
data.body:
Testing #18091

I don't know why, but... I have a thing for fidgeting and selecting blocks of text while reading documentation - it helps me focus. And while going through the editor walkthrough, it bothered me that I couldn't select stuff outside of the embedded editors, and I've seen other people with the same habits as well, so I'm sure I'm not the only one. 

Themarkdown preview has also annoyed me in the past for this reason, but not as much because my focus is usuallyon generating the content rather than on reading it.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] "View Local Changes" in overlay doesn't do justice to the viewlet
data.body:
Testing #18091

It sounds like it's just the open editors view at the top of the explorer, the overlay should mention the fact it deals with SCMs.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Welcome preview should have pointers to other resources
data.body:
Testing #18091

I think it's very easy to get to the end of the editor preview, and wonder- "is that it?" Would be nice to have pointers to next steps (e.g.debugging, terminal, gitetc.)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Editor walkthrough problems persist even when it's closed
data.body:
Testing #18091

I don't have the walkthrough tab open anymore but still have entries in problems view:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/22161472/4dff6c5c-deff-11e6-8968-e60651f87568.png)

Clicking these open the backing file.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Should be able to search editor walkthrough
data.body:
Testing #18091

Unfortunatelyweare currently only able to search the embedded editors because we don't support search in the md preview.
